document.masterDocTitle: Genus Monacha FITZINGER 1833 in Bulgaria (Gastropoda, Pulmonata, Hygromiidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Genus Monacha FITZINGER 1833 in Bulgaria (Gastropoda, Pulmonata, Hygromiidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
1828 Helix
claustralis MENKE
: 12. Locus typicus: "Prevesa", Greece ( MOUSSON 1859: 254 ).

1967
Monacha ( Monacha )
carthusiana HUDEC: 82, fig. 5 (in fig. 6 wrongly applied text).

1968
Monacha ( Monacha ) cartusiana PINTER L.
: 221, fig. 9.

1968
Monacha ( Monacha ) dissimulans PINTER L.
: 221, fig. 5-6, fig. 64-66, fig. 67-69. Locus typicus: "Varna-Kurort", Bulgaria .

1971
Monacha ( Monacha )
carthusiana HUDEC & VASATKO: 29, fig. 16-17.

1973
Monacha ( Monacha ) venusta HUDEC & VASATKO
: 20, fig. 16, pl. 5, fig. 1.

2000b
Monacha ( Monacha ) claustralis HAUSDORF
: 80, fig. 19, pl. 4 fig. 19-20, table 8, map 6.

M. ( M. ) claustralis : Chepelarska River Valley

Genitalia (Fig. 2) : The measurements of some sections of the genitalia are compiled in Table 2 and the variation of the proportions of some sections of the genitalia is represent in Table 3 .

Vertical distribution : In Bulgaria from 0 m alt. to 1600 m alt. in the Mountains. This is a unique species of Genus
Monacha
, who meet in higher elevation in the Mountains.

Ecological data : The species prefer open grassy spaces with high vegetation, but unrarely may be found as synantrophic species in workable areas with agricultures, haymaking meadows and in gardens and courtyards in populated places also. In the towns inhabit in open areas with high grassy vegetation, in abundant number on perennials near by paths.
Zoogeography : Eastersubmediterranean subelement, Submediterranean element, European faunistic complex.
